intro: Dipteronia sinensis subsp. dyeriana, commonly known as the Dyer's dipteronia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with well-drained soils, preferring temperate climates. Its botanical features include compound leaves and pods that contain seeds, making it an interesting subject for botanical study. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
